channel.title: Comments on: Sans Rival – Daring Bakers Challenge November 2011

item.title: By: muppy
item.dc:creator: muppy
item.description: that meringue mix looks great, very delicious :)
item.content:encoded: that meringue mix looks great, very delicious ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Karen
item.dc:creator: Karen
item.description: I have had great success with the recipe on the side of the sunbeam mixed dried fruit packet. I changed the alcohol to tokay (because we like it) and I add some extra glace cherries. I think the recipe is pretty flexible, but also very quick and easy. Everyone who likes fruit cake seems to like it.
item.content:encoded: I have had great success with the recipe on the side of the sunbeam mixed dried fruit packet. I changed the alcohol to tokay (because we like it) and I add some extra glace cherries. I think the recipe is pretty flexible, but also very quick and easy. Everyone who likes fruit cake seems to like it.

item.title: By: whenharrymetcelery
item.dc:creator: whenharrymetcelery
item.description: Your recipe looks fab. The result looks wonderful too. Do drop by my space sometime. I did my first ever dessert recipe and I hope you like it!
item.content:encoded: Your recipe looks fab. The result looks wonderful too. Do drop by my space sometime. I did my first ever dessert recipe and I hope you like it!

item.title: By: Beta Gal
item.dc:creator: Beta Gal
item.description: Both the cake and the bouquet look beautiful. You must have had such a lovely garden to enjoy this past Spring
item.content:encoded: Both the cake and the bouquet look beautiful. You must have had such a lovely garden to enjoy this past Spring

item.title: By: Kim
item.dc:creator: Kim
item.description: Wow, beautiful flowers and Sans Rival! I too feel like every weekend fills up quickly this time of year so it is difficult sometimes to squeeze these challenges in. Your profiteroles sound like they will be delicious. Nice job on the challenge!
item.content:encoded: Wow, beautiful flowers and Sans Rival! I too feel like every weekend fills up quickly this time of year so it is difficult sometimes to squeeze these challenges in. Your profiteroles sound like they will be delicious. Nice job on the challenge!

item.title: By: Jeanne
item.dc:creator: Jeanne
item.description: I've never made a fruit cake, so I can't help you out there. But this Sans Rival cake looks gorgeous!
item.content:encoded: I’ve never made a fruit cake, so I can’t help you out there. But this Sans Rival cake looks gorgeous!

item.title: By: Mary
item.dc:creator: Mary
item.description: Yours sans rival looks gorgeous, but since it is now winter here I am really impressed with the flowers! Only 6 more months till we see some here...
item.content:encoded: Yours sans rival looks gorgeous, but since it is now winter here I am really impressed with the flowers! Only 6 more months till we see some here…

item.title: By: katie
item.dc:creator: katie
item.description: Wow your Sans Rival looks amazing. Mine was a bit 'rustic' Your chocolate buttercream looks so smooth and silky.
item.content:encoded: Wow your Sans Rival looks amazing. Mine was a bit ‘rustic’ Your chocolate buttercream looks so smooth and silky.

item.title: By: Cakelaw
item.dc:creator: Cakelaw
item.description: Your Sans Rival cake turned out well. Love your flowers too. Good luck with the fruitcake.
item.content:encoded: Your Sans Rival cake turned out well. Love your flowers too. Good luck with the fruitcake.

item.title: By: marcellina
item.dc:creator: marcellina
item.description: I'm sorry I don't get around to your blog as often as I would like - you are a marvelous baker! Your Sans Rival looks fabulous as do your flowers - such gorgeous colours! I always make a boiled fruit cake ( I have a great recipe, if you would like it) and prefer to use Captain Morgan rum which gives great flavour. Have a blessed Christmas!
item.content:encoded: I’m sorry I don’t get around to your blog as often as I would like – you are a marvelous baker! Your Sans Rival looks fabulous as do your flowers – such gorgeous colours! I always make a boiled fruit cake ( I have a great recipe, if you would like it) and prefer to use Captain Morgan rum which gives great flavour. Have a blessed Christmas!
